hanzi-su-wiki:
隷

Значения

Раб, покорность

Мнемоника

Завет предков 示 — будь смел, как самурай 士, иначе тебя поймают 康 и отдадут в рабство.

Варианты

隸, 隶

Japanese variant of 隸 |隶
Японский вариант Ли |
rtega_mnemonic:
隸隸RS
隶隶		隷subservient, servant, slave, rad. 171
  • man watched by god 柰 holding a broom 隶: slave
  • ⓢ hand ⺕ holding a broom 丨 → 隶
  • modf. 隸 → 隷
  • RS. a subordinate who has a futile 柰 life with a broom 隶
heisig_constituent: slave, samurai, altar, show, two, small, sieve, rake, grains of rice
koohiiStory1: In an attempt to free them from being slaves to their desires, the samurai stands behind the altar likening a clear mind to a sieve that lets only the purest thoughts through.
koohiiStory2: Careful: retainer (#848). Think of slave in the virtual sense (a slave to your passions). The samurai is standing on the altar lecturing about goodwill (see goodwill (#1097)). He notices the boredom of most of the crowd. However some audience members are attentive about the message of goodwill. The samurai views his sermon as a sieve of character: those of good character pass through and see the merit; those of poor character - slaves to their passions - are blocked from understanding.
WaniKani_Radicals: 士, 示, 聿, 水
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The samurai has a jackhammer, a brush, and some water. All these things tell you that this samurai is actually a slave.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Traditionally, samurai don't carry things like jackhammers, brushes, or water. The samurai is carrying these things for someone else, meaning this samurai is somebody's slave.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You don't like seeing a slave. As you walk by, you hand him a ray (れい) gun so he can free himself.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The samurai slave can use the ray gun to shoot his keeper and get away. Imagine watching him holding up his master and getting away. A ray gun is a truly powerful weapon in the hands of a slave.
Ru_Radicals: 二 (два), 士 (воин), 小 (маленький), ヨ, 水 (вода), 示 (указывать), 隶 (раб)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the samurai (士) shows (示) the slave (隶) to his other slave

隷字的基本解释

隷
lì
同“隶”。

隷
dài
同“隶”。

隷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lì］
［《廣韻》郎計切，去霽，來。］
“隶2”的繁体字。亦作“隷1”。亦作“1”。亦作“1”。亦作“1”。
(1)奴隶；奴仆。
(2)特指奴隶中的一个等级。
(3)罪人。
(4)指低贱的人。
(5)小臣；下臣。
(6)贱。参见“隸臣”。
(7)役使。
(8)指役事。
(9)差役。
(10)附属；隶属。
(11)追随；跟随。
(12)汉字字体的一种。即隶书。
(13)通“肄”。查阅；考察。
(14)通“肄”。研习；研究。
(15)姓。古有史官隶首。见汉张衡《西京赋》。

隷字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【隶字部】　隷； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1363第26
【玉篇】同隸。

隷字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
隷字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lì］
["Guang Yun" Lang Ji cut, go to Ji, come. ]
The traditional characters of "Li 2". Also known as "Li 1". Also known as "1". Also known as "1". Also known as "1".
(1) Slave; slave.
(2) Specifically refers to a class of slaves.
(3) Sinner.
(4) Refers to a lowly person.
(5) Small ministers; subordinates.
(6) Cheap. See "Lichen".
(7) Servants.
(8) Refers to service.
(9) The escort.
(10) Attachment; affiliation.
(11) Follow; follow.
(12) A type of Chinese font. That is the official script.
(13) Through "肄". Check; check.
(14) Through "肄". Study; research.
(15) Last name. In ancient times, there were official historians under the head. See Han Zhang Heng's "Xijing Fu".

lì
яп. вм. 隶
Radicals: 士, 示, 聿, 水  (samurai, jackhammer, brush, water)
Meaning Mnemonic
The samurai has a jackhammer, a brush, and some water. All these things tell you that this samurai is actually a slave.
Traditionally, samurai don't carry things like jackhammers, brushes, or water. The samurai is carrying these things for someone else, meaning this samurai is somebody's slave.
Reading Mnemonic
You don't like seeing a slave. As you walk by, you hand him a ray (れい) gun so he can free himself.
The samurai slave can use the ray gun to shoot his keeper and get away. Imagine watching him holding up his master and getting away. A ray gun is a truly powerful weapon in the hands of a slave.
